setting.name: SSID
setting.description: Set the SSID

setting.name: Network type
setting.description: Set network type. (IBSS means AdHoc)

setting.name: IP Protocol
setting.description: Set/Read the protocol used for the listening port (ATC0).

setting.name: IP Addressing Mode
setting.description: Set/Read the IP addressing mode.

setting.name: Timeout for connection on TCP client sockets
setting.description: Set/Read the timeout (in 100ms units) for connection on TCP client socket. If 0, close socket immediately after sending.

setting.name: Device Type Identifier
setting.description: Set/read the device type identifier value. This can be used to differentiate multiple XBee-based products.

setting.name: Node Identifier
setting.description: Set/read Node Identifier string

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: Read high 16 bits of modem's unique 48-bit MAC Address.

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: Read low 32 bits of modem's unique 48-bit MAC Address.

setting.name: Destination IP Address
setting.description: Set/read the destination IPv4 address. 0xFFFFFFFF is the broadcast address.

setting.name: Destination Port
setting.description: Set/read the destination port number.

setting.name: Source Port
setting.description: Set/read the listening port number for UDP and TCP operations

setting.name: Module IP Address
setting.description: Set/Read the IP address of the module. This command will be read only if module is setup for DHCP

setting.name: IP Address Mask
setting.description: Set/Read the IP address mask. This command will be read only if module is setup for DHCP

setting.name: IP Address of gateway
setting.description: Set/Read the IP address of the gateway. This command will be read only if module is setup for DHCP

setting.name: Encryption Enable
setting.description: Select security mode of access point.

setting.name: Passphrase
setting.description: Sets the passphrase used for WPA and WPA2 security. This value is write only.

setting.name: API Enable
setting.description: Enables API mode.

setting.name: Baud Rate
setting.description: Set/read the serial interface baud rate for communication between modem serial port and host. Request non-standard baud rates with values above 0x80 using a terminal window. Read BD register to find actual baud rate achieved.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: Configure parity for the UART.

setting.name: Stop Bits
setting.description: Configure the number of stop bits for the UART.

setting.name: Packetization Timeout
setting.description: Set/read number of character times of inter-character delay required before transmission begins. Set to zero to transmit characters as they arrive instead of buffering them into one RF packet.

setting.name: DIO6 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO6 line of the module. Options include: RTS flow control, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO7 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO7 line of the module. Options include: CTS flow control, Digital Input and Output, or RS-485 enable control.

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: Set/read the flow control threshold. De-assert CTS when FT bytes are in the UART receive buffer.

setting.name: AD0/DIO0 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD0/DIO0 line of the module. Options include: Analog to Digital converter,Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD1/DIO1 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD1/DIO1 line of the module. Options include: Attention indicator output from SPI slave, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD2/DIO2 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD2/DIO2 line of the module. Options include: SPI Slave clock input, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD3/DIO3 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD3/DIO3 line of the module. Options include: SPI Slave select, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD4/DIO4 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD4/DIO4 line of the module. Options include: SPI Slave MOSI, Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO5/Assoc. Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO5/Assoc. line of the module. Options include: Associated LED indicator (blinks when associated), Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO8 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO8 line of the module. Options include: Sleep request, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO9/ON_SLEEP Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO9 line of the module. Options include: ON/SLEEP Indicator, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO10/PWM0 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO10/PWM0 line of the module. Options include: PWM Output, Digital Input, and Output.

setting.name: DIO11/PWM1 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO11/PWM1 line of the module. Options include: PWM1 Output, Digital Input, and Output.

setting.name: DIO12 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO12 line of the module. Options include: SPI Slave MISO, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO13 Configuration
setting.description: Enable or disable DIO13 for UART output.

setting.name: DIO14 Configuration
setting.description: Enable or disable DIO14 for UART input.

setting.name: Associate LED Blink Time
setting.description: Set/read the Associate LED blink rate. This value determines the blink rate of the Associate/DIO5 pin if D5=1 and the module has started a network. Setting LT to 0 will use the default blink time (250ms).

setting.name: Pull-up/down Resistor Enable
setting.description: Set/read bitfield to configure internal pull-up/down resistors status for I/O lines. 1=internal pull-up/down enabled, 0=no internal pull-up/down. Bitfield map: (14)-DIO13/DOUT, (13)-DIO7/CTS, (12)-DIO11/PWM1, (11)-DIO10/PWM0, (10)-DIO12, (9)-On/Sleep, (8)Associate, (7)-DIN/Config, (6)-Sleep_Rq, (5)-RTS, (4)-AD0/DIO0, (3)-AD1/DIO1, (2)-AD2/DIO2, (1)-AD3/DIO3, (0)-DIO4

setting.name: Pull Direction
setting.description: Set/read resistor direction (1=pullup, 0=pull-down) for corresponding I/O lines that are set in PR command.

setting.name: Analog Voltage reference
setting.description: Set/read analog voltage reference. Specifies the volts for an analog reading of 0x03ff, where a reading of 0x200 indicates a voltage input that is half of VREF

setting.name: PWM0 duty cycle
setting.description: Sets the duty cycle of PWM0 if P0=2.

setting.name: PWM1 duty cycle
setting.description: Sets the duty cycle of PWM1 if P1=2.

setting.name: DIO Change Detect
setting.description: Set/Read bitfield values for change detect monitoring.Each bit enables monitoring of DIO0-DIO12 for changes. If detected, data is transmitted with DIO data only.

setting.name: Sample Rate
setting.description: Set/read sample rate. When set this parameter causes the modem to sample all enabled DIO and ADC at a specified interval.

setting.name: Sample From Sleep Rate
setting.description: Set/read the number of sleep cycles that must elapse between periodic IO samples. This allows IO samples to be taken only during some wake cycles. During those cycles IO samples are taken at the rate specified by IR.

setting.name: AT Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: Set/read command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, modem returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: Set required period of silence before, after and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: Set/read character value to be used to break from data mode to command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character.

setting.name: Association Indication
setting.description: Read Association status code to monitor association progress.

setting.name: Rssi of Access point
setting.description: Read the RSSI of the access point when it was last joined (or FF if not joined).

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read modem firmware version number.

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Read modem hardware version number.

setting.name: Hardware Revision
setting.description: Read modem hardware revision number.

setting.name: Supply voltage
setting.description: Read supply voltage in millivolt units.

setting.name: Temperature
setting.description: Read temperature of module in degrees Celsius.

setting.name: Configuration Code
setting.description: Read the configuration code associated with the current AT command configuration.

setting.name: Maximum Number of RF Payload Bytes
setting.description: Read the maximum number of RF payload bytes that can be sent in a single RF transmission.

setting.name: Power Level
setting.description: Select/Read transmitter output power.

setting.name: Channel # of Access point
setting.description: Read the channel number of access point (or FF if not joined).

setting.name: Bit Rate of IBSS Creator
setting.description: Data rate; MCS0-7 are 802.11n data rates from 6.5Mbps to 65Mbps

setting.name: Wake Host Delay
setting.description: Set/read the time the module will delay before sending serial data out the UART or taking IO samples after waking from sleep. This can be used to give a sleeping host processor sufficient time to power up after the module asserts the ON_SLEEP line.

setting.name: Sleep Options
setting.description: Bitfield of options for sleeping node. Bit 6 - Stay associated with AP during sleep. All other bits ignored.

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Normal mode is always awake. Pin sleep is based on SleepRq pin. Cyclic mode sleeps for SP time and wakes for ST time. Cyclic sleep pin wake is same as cyclic sleep if SleepRq is negated. If it is asserted, the module goes to sleep after ST expires. It then stays asleep until SleepRq is asserted or until SP expires, whichever occurs first. Once negated, the module will sleep .

setting.name: Sleep Time
setting.description: In deep, cyclic sleep mode, node will sleep with CTS disabled for the sleep time interval, then wake for the wake time interval.

setting.name: Wake Time
setting.description: Wake time for clyclic sleep modes. New data will not refresh the timer. However, if there is data to transmit or receive after ST expires, those actions will occur before the module goes to sleep.

category.name: Firmware actions
category.description: This firmware allows you to execute the following actions.
